body_html:
License section (will need to update when info is 100%)

What is ok or is not ok changes depending on a few things, one big one is if the binaries are included in the build or just used to compile and the user has to install the libraries to use them. At a glance I believe all of the code is being included in the binary and I am listing what I see below.

  • ngraph: Apache
  • nlohmann_json_lib (json c++ lib) MIT
  • ngraph_tf (ngraph bridge for tensorflow) Apache

These all look ok. I know Apache is an approved license and I am nearly 100% sure MIT is.
@thirupalanisamy owns the final confirmation but at a glance this looks fine.

body:
License section (will need to update when info is 100%)

What is ok or is not ok changes depending on a few things, one big one is if the binaries are included in the build or just used to compile and the user has to install the libraries to use them.  At a glance I believe all of the code is being included in the binary and I am listing what I see below.

   * [ngraph](https://github.com/NervanaSystems/ngraph): Apache
   * [nlohmann_json_lib](https://github.com/nlohmann/json/blob/develop/LICENSE.MIT) (json c++ lib)  MIT 
   * [ngraph_tf](https://github.com/NervanaSystems/ngraph-tf) (ngraph bridge for tensorflow) Apache

These all look ok. I know Apache is an approved license and I am nearly 100% sure MIT is. 
 @thirupalanisamy owns the final confirmation but at a glance this looks fine.
